009
010package Ch25_SIFT;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.sets.ColorEnumeration.getColors;
013import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
014
015import java.awt.Color;
016import java.awt.Font;
017import java.awt.Shape;
018import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
019import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
020import java.awt.geom.QuadCurve2D;
021import java.util.List;
022
023import ij.IJ;
024import ij.ImagePlus;
025import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
026import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
027import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
028import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
029import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
030import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
031import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
032import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
033import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
034import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
035import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
036import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftColors;
037import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftDescriptor;
038import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftDetector;
039import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftMatch;
040import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftMatcher;
041import imagingbook.common.sift.SiftParameters;
042import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
043
044/**
045 * <p>
046 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the SIFT detection and matching framework. See Sec. 25.5 of [1] for
047 * details.
048 * </p>
049 * <p>
050 * The plugin takes a single image, which is assumed to be composed of a left and right frame. The input image is split
051 * horizontally, then SIFT detection and matching is applied to the two sub-images. The input image is always converted
052 * to grayscale (and normalized to [0,1]) before SIFT feature detection is performed. The result is displayed as a
053 * graphic overlay by connecting and annotating the best-matching features. When saved as a TIFF image the overlay is
054 * preserved.
055 * </p>
056 * <p>
057 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
058 * (2022).
059 * </p>
060 *
061 * @author WB
062 * @version 2022/11/20
063 */
064public class SIFT_Matching_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
065        
066        // matching parameters:
067        private static NormType DistanceNormType = SiftMatcher.DefaultNormType;
068        private static double MaxDistanceRatio = SiftMatcher.DefaultRMax;
069
070        // display parameters:
071        private static int NumberOfMatchesToShow = 25;
072        private static double FeatureScale = 1.0;
073        private static boolean ShowFeatureLabels = true;
074
075        private static double MatchLineCurvature = 0.25;
076        private static double FeatureStrokewidth = 1.0;
077
078        private static BasicAwtColor MatchLineColor = BasicAwtColor.Magenta;
079        private static BasicAwtColor LabelColor = BasicAwtColor.Yellow;
080        private static Font LabelFont = new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 12);
081        
082        private static Color[] ScaleLevelColors = getColors(SiftColors.class);
083        
084        private ImagePlus im = null;
085
086        /**
087         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
088         */
089        public SIFT_Matching_Demo() {
090                if (noCurrentImage()) {
091                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.RamsesSmall);
092                }
093        }
094        
095        @Override
096        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus im) {
097                this.im = im;
098                return DOES_ALL;
099        }
100
101        @Override
102        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {            
103                if (!runDialog()) {
104                        return;
105                }
106
107                final int w = ip.getWidth();
108                final int h = ip.getHeight();
109                final int w2 = w / 2;
110                
111                FloatProcessor Ia = IjUtils.crop(ip, 0, 0, w2, h).convertToFloatProcessor();
112                FloatProcessor Ib = IjUtils.crop(ip, w2, 0, w2, h).convertToFloatProcessor();
113                
114                SiftParameters siftParams = new SiftParameters();
115                // modify SIFT parameters here if needed
116                
117                // we use the same parameters on left and right image
118                SiftDetector sdA = new SiftDetector(Ia, siftParams);
119                SiftDetector sdB = new SiftDetector(Ib, siftParams);
120                
121                List<SiftDescriptor> fsA = sdA.getSiftFeatures();
122                List<SiftDescriptor> fsB = sdB.getSiftFeatures();
123
124                IJ.log("SIFT features found in left image: "  + fsA.size());
125                IJ.log("SIFT features found in right image: " + fsB.size());
126
127                // create a SIFT matcher and perform matching:
128                SiftMatcher sm = new SiftMatcher(DistanceNormType, MaxDistanceRatio);
129                List<SiftMatch> matches = sm.match(fsA, fsB);   // matches are sorted by decreasing quality
130                
131                IJ.log("Matches found: " + matches.size());
132                if (matches.isEmpty()) {
133                        return;
134                }
135
136                // --------------------------------------------------
137                
138                ColoredStroke matchLineStroke = new ColoredStroke(0.2, MatchLineColor.getColor());
139                ColoredStroke[] fStrokes = new ColoredStroke[ScaleLevelColors.length];
140                for (int i = 0; i < ScaleLevelColors.length; i++) {
141                        fStrokes[i] = new ColoredStroke(FeatureStrokewidth, ScaleLevelColors[i]);
142                }
143                
144                ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
145                ola.setTextColor(LabelColor.getColor());
146                ola.setFont(LabelFont);
147                
148                AffineTransform trans = AffineTransform.getTranslateInstance(w2, 0);
149                
150                // add vertical separator between left and right image:
151                ola.addShape(new Line2D.Double(w2 - 0.5, 0, w2 - 0.5, h), 
152                                new ColoredStroke(0.2, Color.green, 5)); 
153                
154                // add SIFT markers, connecting lines and number labels
155                int n = 1;
156                for (SiftMatch m : matches) {
157                        SiftDescriptor dA = m.getDescriptor1();
158                        SiftDescriptor dB = m.getDescriptor2();
159                        
160                        // draw the matched SIFT markers:
161                        Shape sA = dA.getShape(FeatureScale);
162                        Shape sB = trans.createTransformedShape(dB.getShape(FeatureScale));
163                        ola.addShape(sA, fStrokes[dA.getScaleLevel() % fStrokes.length]);
164                        ola.addShape(sB, fStrokes[dB.getScaleLevel() % fStrokes.length]);
165                        
166                        // draw the connecting lines:
167                        Shape cAB = makeConnectingShape(dA, dB.plus(w2, 0));
168                        ola.addShape(cAB, matchLineStroke);
169                        
170                        // draw the numeric feature labels on both sides:
171                        if (ShowFeatureLabels) {
172                                String label = Integer.toString(n);     
173                                ola.addText(dA.getX(), dA.getY(), label);
174                                ola.addText(dB.getX() + w2, dB.getY(), label);
175                        }
176                        if (++n > NumberOfMatchesToShow) break;
177                }
178
179                im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
180        }
181        
182        // -------------------------
183        
184        private Shape makeConnectingShape(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2) {
185                double x1 = p1.getX(); 
186                double y1 = p1.getY();
187                double x2 = p2.getX(); 
188                double y2 = p2.getY();
189                double dx = x2 - x1;
190                double dy = y2 - y1;
191                double ctrlx = (x1 + x2) / 2 - MatchLineCurvature * dy;
192                double ctrly = (y1 + y2) / 2 + MatchLineCurvature * dx;
193                return new QuadCurve2D.Double(x1, y1, ctrlx, ctrly, x2, y2);
194        }
195        
196        // -------------------------
197        
198        private boolean runDialog() {
199                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());  
200                gd.addMessage("This plugin expects a single image composed of a left and right frame.");
201                
202                gd.addMessage("SIFT matching parameters:");
203                gd.addEnumChoice("Distance norm type", DistanceNormType);
204                gd.addNumericField("Max. ratio between 1st/2nd match (rMax)", MaxDistanceRatio, 2);
205                
206                gd.addMessage("Display parameters:");
207                gd.addNumericField("Number of matches to show", NumberOfMatchesToShow, 0);
208                gd.addNumericField("Feature scale", FeatureScale, 2);
209                gd.addNumericField("Match line curvature", MatchLineCurvature, 2);
210                gd.addEnumChoice("Match line color", MatchLineColor);
211                gd.addEnumChoice("Label color", LabelColor);
212                gd.addCheckbox("Show feature labels", ShowFeatureLabels);
213                
214                gd.showDialog();
215                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
216                        return false;
217                }
218                
219                DistanceNormType = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NormType.class);
220                MaxDistanceRatio = gd.getNextNumber();
221                NumberOfMatchesToShow = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
222                FeatureScale = gd.getNextNumber();
223                MatchLineCurvature = gd.getNextNumber();
224                MatchLineColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
225                LabelColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
226                ShowFeatureLabels = gd.getNextBoolean();
227                return true;
228        }
229
230}
